titles: A combate betvveen Satan tempting: and a Christian triumphing: in the comfort of the creed.
publisher: Printed for the good of all true and loyall subjects,
notes: Verse - "Satan. VVhy doest with hope (vild wretch) thy soule deceive?".
Alternate lines finished with a phrase from the Apostles' Creed.
Reproductions of the originals in the Harvard Library (Early English books) and in the British Library (Thomason Tracts).
keywords: Apostles' Creed --  Poetry --  Early works to 1800.
